intro: Pyrrocoma erythropappa, commonly known as the red-veined bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped with prominent red veins, adding to its ornamental value. Pyrrocoma erythropappa is valued in horticulture for its unique appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
